description.narrative: Funding under this Initiative will help Vietnam address its dearth of engineering skills by providing 30 in-country scholarships in engineering through RMIT International University Vietnam. The Initiative will see cooperation between the Aid Program, RMIT Vietnam and industry partners, including through joint funding, to build a strong engineering foundation for Vietnam at RMIT Vietnam. In the medium term, it will be sustained by self-funded Vietnamese and international students. The Initiative is directly aligned with one of the three pillars of the Vietnam-Australia Country Strategy 2010-2015, namely "Improvement in the quality of Vietnam's human resources". It complements the 225 Australian Development Scholarships provided by the Aid Program every year for tertiary education in Australia in sectors that are central to Vietnam's economic and social development. The total value of this initiative is $1.5 million over 3 years, starting 2010-11.
